title: Pixel 4a notification loop on usb c headphones
content:
When I'm using my usb-c headphones on the pixel 4a sometimes the notification for a received message instead of ringing once keeps going on forever, this doesn't stop even when plugging out headphones and only stops with a reboot

Example:
Phone is not on do not disturb and is either on loud or on vibrate
A starred contact writes to me on whatsapp
I hear the notification as normal but then the same notification sound starts playing as a media in a loop

I can lower it by lowering the media audio (not the notification volume) but as soon as I raise it the sound continues

Even unplugging headphones the sound continues until I reboot the phone

This ring also happens when phone is set to vibrate but not in do not disturb, in do not disturb I hear no notification sounds even when I should

The sound is the custom notification associated with the contact, if I change the custom notification it changes the sound played on repeat

This only happens with usb-c headphones, I have tested with (non-google) bluetooth headphones and it works as normal

This started happening from the first time I ever used the usbc headphones on a brand new pixel 4a (5 minutes after first turn on)

Update: I tested without custom notification and the same issue still occours
